# The `Module` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

A <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> instance is used to store all the information related to an LLVM module. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::Module</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

A <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> instance is used to store all the information related to an LLVM module.

Modules are the top level container of all other LLVM Intermediate Representation (IR) objects. Each module directly contains a list of globals variables, a list of functions, a list of libraries (or other modules) this module depends on, a symbol table, and various data about the target&#39;s characteristics.

A module maintains a GlobalList object that is used to hold all constant references to global variables in the module. When a global variable is destroyed, it should have no entries in the GlobalList. The main container class for the LLVM Intermediate Representation.

Definition at line 65 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/module-h">Module.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Functions

### dropTriviallyDeadConstantArrays() {#a288bf7fe3df7b3822b5763009cc81366}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void Module::dropTriviallyDeadConstantArrays ()">
Destroy ConstantArrays in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext">LLVMContext</a> if they are not used.

ConstantArrays constructed during linking can cause quadratic memory explosion. Releasing all unused constants can cause a 20% LTO compile-time slowdown for a large application.

NOTE: Constants are currently owned by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext">LLVMContext</a>. This can then only be called where all uses of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext">LLVMContext</a> are understood.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/module-h/#l00885">885</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/module-h">Module.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/llvmcontextimpl-cpp/#l00173">173</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/llvmcontextimpl-cpp">LLVMContextImpl.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### enum  {#a0a5c55e12c97b80021330fe82b642293}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="enum llvm::Module::ModFlagBehavior ">
This enumeration defines the supported behaviors of module flags.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="a0a5c55e12c97b80021330fe82b642293a4771bacd44b97e736b819b5d06b22dfe" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Error">
Emits an error if two values disagree, otherwise the resulting value is that of the operands (= 1)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a0a5c55e12c97b80021330fe82b642293a355bc901e05417401ee44323a8595131" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Warning">
Emits a warning if two values disagree (= 2)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a0a5c55e12c97b80021330fe82b642293aec0586c2f89c73dcc00841aa000141bb" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Require">
Adds a requirement that another module flag be present and have a specified value after linking is performed (= 3)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a0a5c55e12c97b80021330fe82b642293a2aba8031539d1446aff14d13c7deea69" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Override">
Uses the specified value, regardless of the behavior or value of the other module (= 4)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a0a5c55e12c97b80021330fe82b642293a7a6b9b7ed3797ab927caf581353e935a" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Append">
Appends the two values, which are required to be metadata nodes (= 5)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a0a5c55e12c97b80021330fe82b642293a2486ec4ce4f33e42da3ad60d6e9eff4a" />
<EnumerationListItem name="AppendUnique">
Appends the two values, which are required to be metadata nodes (= 6)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a0a5c55e12c97b80021330fe82b642293a89821032d3b24b6a135f1d5acfbcd2c8" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Max">
Takes the max of the two values, which are required to be integers (= 7)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a0a5c55e12c97b80021330fe82b642293a74e5a703504f88f6b34e9f31e8ae5160" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Min">
Takes the min of the two values, which are required to be integers (= 8)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a0a5c55e12c97b80021330fe82b642293a59bf24a6d7675e80c400f121f5b743b8" />
<EnumerationListItem name="ModFlagBehaviorFirstVal">
 (= Error)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a0a5c55e12c97b80021330fe82b642293ae2c6e1fe630700ebf839c90b6c04627e" />
<EnumerationListItem name="ModFlagBehaviorLastVal">

</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

## Module Level Accessors

### createRNG {#a8b82325a22b25d4278a37af30b202a30}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; RandomNumberGenerator &gt; Module::createRNG (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Name) const</>}>
Get a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/randomnumbergenerator">RandomNumberGenerator</a> salted for use with this module.

The RNG can be seeded via -rng-seed=&lt;uint64&gt; and is salted with the ModuleID and the provided pass salt. The returned RNG should not be shared across threads or passes.

A unique RNG per pass ensures a reproducible random stream even when other randomness consuming passes are added or removed. In addition, the random stream will be reproducible across LLVM versions when the pass does not change.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/module-h/#l00317">317</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/module-h">Module.h</a>, definition at line 148 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/module-cpp">Module.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getOrInsertFunction {#abb107e4edbf05eae92936cba6801c2d9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>FunctionCallee Module::getOrInsertFunction (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Name, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functiontype">FunctionType</a> &#42; T, AttributeList AttributeList)</>}>
Look up the specified function in the module symbol table.

If it does not exist, add a prototype for the function and return it. Otherwise, return the existing function.

In all cases, the returned value is a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functioncallee">FunctionCallee</a> wrapper around the &#39;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functiontype">FunctionType</a> <em>T&#39; passed in, as well as the &#39;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a></em>&#39; of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a>. The function type of the function may differ from the function type stored in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functioncallee">FunctionCallee</a> if it was previously created with a different type.

Note: For library calls <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a87cba3c4c88ab5df01a7f7dece1e0266">getOrInsertLibFunc()</a> should be used instead.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/module-h/#l00405">405</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/module-h">Module.h</a>, definition at line 204 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/module-cpp">Module.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getGlobalVariable {#ac8812c64092590a5ebde21f70c538d1b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>GlobalVariable &#42; Module::getGlobalVariable (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Name, bool AllowLocal) const</>}>
getGlobalVariable - Look up the specified global variable in the module symbol table.

If it does not exist, return null. The type argument should be the underlying type of the global, i.e., it should not have the top-level <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointertype">PointerType</a>, which represents the address of the global. If AllowLocal is set to true, this function will return types that have an local. By default, these types are not returned.

### getOrInsertGlobal {#abd8f7242df6ecb10f429c4d39403c334}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Constant &#42; Module::getOrInsertGlobal (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Name, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">function&#95;ref</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvariable">GlobalVariable</a> &#42;()&gt; CreateGlobalCallback)</>}>
Look up the specified global in the module symbol table.

getOrInsertGlobal - Look up the specified global in the module symbol table.

If it does not exist, invoke a callback to create a declaration of the global and return it. The global is constantexpr casted to the expected type if necessary.


<ul>
<li>If it does not exist, add a declaration of the global and return it.</li>
<li>Else, the global exists but has the wrong type: return the function with a constantexpr cast to the right type.</li>
<li>Finally, if the existing global is the correct declaration, return the existing global.</li>
</ul>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/module-h/#l00475">475</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/module-h">Module.h</a>, definition at line 258 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/module-cpp">Module.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setMaterializer {#a1a67a7e46fd17084b2ea152d2d435253}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void Module::setMaterializer (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gvmaterializer">GVMaterializer</a> &#42; GVM)</>}>
Sets the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gvmaterializer">GVMaterializer</a> to GVM.

This module must not yet have a Materializer. To reset the materializer for a module that already has one, call materializeAll first. Destroying this module will destroy its materializer without materializing any more GlobalValues. Without destroying the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a>, there is no way to detach or destroy a materializer without materializing all the GVs it controls, to avoid leaving orphan unmaterialized GVs.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/module-h/#l00566">566</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/module-h">Module.h</a>, definition at line 461 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/module-cpp">Module.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<SectionDefinition>

## Utility functions for printing and dumping Module objects

### dropAllReferences {#a61b1317d05efe05a549bf94bc949e0d0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void Module::dropAllReferences ()">
This function causes all the subinstructions to &quot;let go&quot; of all references that they are maintaining.

This allows one to &#39;delete&#39; a whole class at a time, even though there may be circular references... first all references are dropped, and all use counts go to zero. Then everything is delete&#39;d for real. Note that no operations are valid on an object that has &quot;dropped all references&quot;, except operator delete.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/module-h/#l00907">907</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/module-h">Module.h</a>, definition at line 563 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/module-cpp">Module.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### dump {#a9b4c67a0936fe59c9511ff591b97f260}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void Module::dump () const">

</MemberDefinition>

### print {#a8ee5166cba8576e41617fc96aec1fb85}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void Module::print (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp; OS, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/assemblyannotationwriter">AssemblyAnnotationWriter</a> &#42; AAW, bool ShouldPreserveUseListOrder=false, bool IsForDebug=false) const</>}>
Print the module to an output stream with an optional <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/assemblyannotationwriter">AssemblyAnnotationWriter</a>.

If <code>ShouldPreserveUseListOrder</code>, then include uselistorder directives so that use-lists can be recreated when reading the assembly.
